TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Doin' the Work" Edition

Articles.Content:
Ok, even though I'm not a 'plane' guy, I'm loving that new Mk3 look. So sleek, so powerful...excellent in every way (and I'll be glad to not see that old ugly Mk3 cockpit wasting space.) The editor looks like it will be a huge step forward as well, can't wait to mess around with that. I'm really, really excited for .90.

As for the name of version .90, it should be something that captures what Beta really means for players, as well as for KSP development going forward. I think it should be called "KSP version 0.90: ...and that's where you come in."

Great devnotes! Definitely getting hyped about 0.90 now.

Some form of a takeoff mass limit for the earlier tiers of the space center makes sense. I hope the final tier won't have a limit though - it's fun launching monstrosities sometimes.

Good to hear that more experienced Kerbals will gain abilities like fixing wheels and repacking parachutes. That'll give me a good reason to bring along a trained crew for specialist missions.

The Mk3 cockpit is looking awesome. Looking forward to getting to play with the whole set of new parts.

Keep up the great work guys!

Nice!

I really hope the beautiful shuttle cockpit will have an interior!

Mk3 parts are looking great. More quality work from Porkjet.

By the looks of the adapters there will be some integration with the Mk2 parts so they aren't totally separate sets of parts.

Hope there is a proper nosecone for it though. Perhaps a docking port or atmospheric sensor part to give it a use other than just capping the nose off.

Is there any plan to bring the Mk1 parts into line with the new Mk2 and Mk3 parts? Currently Mk1 looks a bit out of place.

Will there be any bigger engines for hauling this airframe in orbit or will we just use clusters of RAPIERs? Even a scaled up 1.25 m RAPIER would work.

The new part highlight looks great.

The Toolbar-like section looks interesting. Is this the new widget area?

holy crap those mk3 parts! HNNNNNNNG

Edited November 26, 2014 by KasperVld
minor profanity

Great look to the new UI there. Looks like a lot more room for parts tabs, presumably for the advanced search system. Might mods also be able to add their own tabs there? Would be a big help for eg stuff like TAC LS, which could have its own tab instead of cluttering utility.

Ay caramba! I did not even look on that part of the screen!

The mk3 parts are even better than I expected! :0

They look absolutely amazing. I'm liking them more than B9!

EDIT: New engine on the last pic? Doesn't look like skipper or mainsail.

Edited November 26, 2014 by Veeltch

The mk3 parts are even better than I expected! :0

They look absolutely amazing. I'm liking them more than B9!

EDIT: New engine on the last pic? Doesn't look like skipper or mainsail.

That is the 3.75m single engine I believe.

The mk3 parts are even better than I expected! :0

They look absolutely amazing. I'm liking them more than B9!

EDIT: New engine on the last pic? Doesn't look like skipper or mainsail.

The adapter at the end of this spaceplane is the mk3 to 3.75m adapter - the engine is the KR-2L

The adapter at the end of this spaceplane is the mk3 to 3.75m adapter - the engine is the KR-2L

Oh yeah, it is forgot 'bout that one.

Damn it! Those mk3s really got me hyped like nothing before!

As for guessing the mistake... If it isn't dropping the liquid fueled boosters too early (or hanging on to the SRBs after they're spent), then isn't that vessel waaaay too much rocket just for Kerbin orbit? But not enough for a Mun or Minmus landing. Is it maybe going for orbital science above Minmus?
My best wishes to Rowsdower and his bride.

Some other guesses for Ted's mistake:

No electrical system.

No fuel lines.

Great devnotes, the Mk3 parts look fantastic (and include a 2.5m-Mk2 adapter!). Congrats to Rowsdower, hope you have many happy decades together.
Does he need electrics and fuel lines? The LV-T's provide power and the pod has some storage, it's not asparagus either, the core has more fuel to last longer...

Does he need electrics and fuel lines? The LV-T's provide power and the pod has some storage, it's not asparagus either, the core has more fuel to last longer...

No, neither are necessary depending on the mission (and it looks like early tech so neither are likely available). It's a couple of long shot guesses, the more obvious stuff was already guessed.

I think they will though. Note the pic showing the Mk3 parts against the orange tank. Why would that be posted if not to show that the 2.5m parts will fit in the Mk3 bays?

Because he was doing an awesome MAKS Spaceplane replica? I actually want to see the Mriya he made to lift that up. But don't worry, MkIII cargo bays capable of fitting 2.5m parts have been confirmed for some time.

Other than that, nice devnotes. I have no issues with anything, other than the fact it's not done already (don't stress yourselves though! I can wait... somehow ^^'). A clarification on the cloud issue would be nice though (though since I spy FAR in there, that could very well be modded installs). Oh, and of course congrats on the wedding.

Edit: all my guesses for what's wrong with the rocket have already been said: the most obvious is the staging issue, but if those separatrons on the capsule are for slowing down before opening the chutes, they point the wrong way. However, if they are to deorbit, then they are genius, since they obviate the need for an electrical system to maintain orientation: wait until you are pointing prograde, then fire deorbit engines. An RCS system to maintain orientation manually would complete the realism, tough.

Rune. Whomever built the MAKS spaceplane deserves cookies.

Edited November 26, 2014 by Rune
Every time I think I've seen all the real-life proposed spaceplane designs engineers have cooked up, somebody comes up with another surprise. That MAKS is cool.
Wow, these MK3 Parts are looking fantastic! Also..CLOUDS!!!!?? O-o Or did they just forget turning them off while making those screenshots?

Wow, these MK3 Parts are looking fantastic! Also..CLOUDS!!!!?? O-o Or did they just forget turning them off while making those screenshots?

Unfortunately, Porkjet confirmed in another thread that he had forgotten to swtich EVE off :-(

Unfortunately, Porkjet confirmed in another thread that he had forgotten to swtich EVE off :-(

That's just because he subconsciously knows that's what stock is SUPPOSED to look like.

That's just because he subconsciously knows that's what stock is SUPPOSED to look like.

We all know that and Squad knows that too. I say, we will see cool clouds before 1.0.

Some other guesses for Ted's mistake:

No electrical system.

No fuel lines.

Great devnotes, the Mk3 parts look fantastic (and include a 2.5m-Mk2 adapter!). Congrats to Rowsdower, hope you have many happy decades together.

Pretty sure the mistake is a staging error. Look at stage 3, he is dropping his SRBs and LFOs at the same time, it's doubtful they would run out at the same time, and in the second screen shot you can see they aren't.

Its a staging error. The decouplers were firing togheter detaching your boosters and your still almost full liquid fuel boosters.

Wahey, you guessed correctly first! It was a tad messy as I realised my mistake just too late...

As for guessing the mistake... If it isn't dropping the liquid fueled boosters too early (or hanging on to the SRBs after they're spent), then isn't that vessel waaaay too much rocket just for Kerbin orbit? But not enough for a Mun or Minmus landing. Is it maybe going for orbital science above Minmus?

Yeah, staging the LF boosters far too early.

It was for a high Kerbin orbit, with no fuel lines it was a pretty comfy ascent - I'd rather have too much than too little.

Edited November 26, 2014 by Ted

This update is going to make me use 1 less mod: fine print. It is coming to the game!

Yes, I boarded the hype train too. Apparently we're going to get massive cargo bays and a huge landing gear.

This is going to make career mode so much more enjoyable, thank you! I recently discovered how much fun contracts are, and how much fun fine print is.

I have one question though. Will we be getting something like the mod final frontier? To give Kerbals medals/awards for extraordinary tasks?

Edited November 26, 2014 by FunnyBunny14

This update is going to make me use 1 less mod: fine print. It is coming to the game!

That's pretty much my hope for KSP, too; empty out my mod folder.

Spaceplane Plus and Fine Print already done, clouds and hopefully tolerable aerodynamics on the way. Now I just have to sacrifice a goat or something to get Chatterer, Deadly Reentry, Raster Prop Monitor, Scansat and Kerbal Flight Data in.
